_meanings:
{@--1@} The act of
standing or remaining, stay, 
continuance, residence; <ls>U. 3. 32.</ls>

{@--2@}
Being fixed or stationary.

{@--3@} A
state, condition.

{@--5@} Station,
situation, position.

{@--6@} Relation,
capacity; {#pitfsTAne#} ‘in the place or
capacity of a father’; {#BakzyasTAne#}  
<ls>Pt. 2. 26.</ls>

{@--9@} Office, rank, 
dignity; {#amAtyasTAne niyojitaH#}.
{@--15@} A holy place.
{@--16@} An altar.

{@--17@} Aplace in a town,
square, court.

{@--18@} The place or 

sphere assigned after death to 
persons according as they perform or
neglect their prescribed duties.

{@--21@} A stationary
condition, a neutral or middle
state.

{@--22@} That which constitutes
the chief strength or the very 
existence of a kingdom, a stamina of
a kingdom; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} army, treasure,
town, and territory; <ls>Ms. 7. 56</ls> (where
<ls>Kull.</ls> renders {#sTAnaM#} by  
{#daMqakozapurarAzwrAtmakaM caturviDaM#}).

{@--23@} Likeness, 
resemblance.

{@--24@} Part or division of a
work, section, chapter &c.

{@--25@} The
character or part of an actor.

{@--26@}
Interval, opportunity, leisure.
{1} a local governor.

{2} the 
superintendent of a place.

{3} a watchman.
police-officer.

<ab>du.</ab> 
standing and sitting down.

confinement to a place, imprisonment,
arrest; <ab>cf.</ab> {#AseDa#}.

a kind
of quarter-master.

see  
{#sTAnaBrazwa#}.

a watchman, sentinel,
policeman.

a dwelling-place,
mansion.

ejected from an
office, displaced, dismissed, out of
employ.

{1} the greatness
or glory of any place.

{2} a kind of
divine virtue or uncommon sanctity
supposed to be inherent in a sacred
spot.

being
in one's abode, at home.
